pr_title: Add stop button within job output display

timeline.message:
Add stop button to job output display
- move JobResources from JobItem to new class
- add stop button to JobProgress displayed with job output
- add eventBus to JobProgress so it can stop the job

timeline.bodyText:
Minor style thing: new code can use lambda syntax instead of anonymous class, so:
stop_.addClickHandler(clickEvent -> eventBus_.fireEvent(new JobExecuteActionEvent(job.id, JobConstants.ACTION_STOP));
timeline.author: gtritchie

timeline.message: switch anonymous class for lambda syntax

timeline.bodyText: Whether or not a job is stoppable is independent of whether or not it has a progress bar. I think we should make the button visible based on whether or not the job implements the stop action.
timeline.author: jmcphers

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing this out! I reverted the original comments and updated the stop button logic.
replies.author: melissa-barca

timeline.message:
show stop button when job is not complete and implements the stop action
remove code showing stop button based on progress bar

timeline.bodyText: No need for this test since it's inside an if statement that already guarantees the condition.
timeline.author: jmcphers

timeline.message: Merge branch 'v1.4' of https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio into feature/interrupt-job-output
